    #Algebraic Geometry
    2009

State the necessary and sufficient conditions for ϕD\phi_{D}ϕD​ to be finite. State the necessary and sufficient conditions for ϕD\phi_{D}ϕD​ to be an isomorphism onto its image.

    Let VVV have genus 2 , and let KKK be an effective canonical divisor. Show that the morphism ϕK\phi_{K}ϕK​ is a morphism of degree 2 from VVV to P1\mathbb{P}^{1}P1.

    By considering the divisor K+P1+P2K+P_{1}+P_{2}K+P1​+P2​ for points PiP_{i}Pi​ with P1+P2≁KP_{1}+P_{2} \nsim KP1​+P2​≁K, show that there exists a birational morphism from VVV to a singular plane quartic.

    [You may assume the Riemann-Roch Theorem.]
